types.name: Activity

ActivityInput represents what the user is doing right now.

If type is WATCHING, userID must be supplied.

If type is PLAYING, gameID must be supplied.

types.name: ActivityType
types.description: The categories of activities which users can engage in.

types.name: AddChannelBlockedTermError

types.name: AddChannelBlockedTermPayload

types.name: AddChannelPermittedTermError
types.description: Possible errors that this resolver returns.

types.name: AddChannelPermittedTermInput
types.description: AddChannelPermittedTermInput takes in the channel, phrases, and if the term should be editable by mods.

types.name: AddChannelPermittedTermPayload

types.name: AddCollectionItemInput

types.name: AmazonMarketplace

AmazonMarketplace represents the Amazon specific term for "marketplace",

types.name: BitsLeaderboardItem

types.name: BitsPurchaseToken

types.name: CheerSettings

There are different algorithms that return a different set of related clips.
They only return up to 4 clips per list.

An enumeration on the different time frames to filter clips results based on

types.name: ClipsSort

types.name: Collection
types.description: Collection (a.k.a. Playlist) is a backend concept for a list of videos.

A page entry, that contains a collection item and a cursor to return

These two types allow clients to query for a LIST of COLLECTIONS
(i.e. a two-dimensional array of videos).

types.name: CollectionsOptions
types.description: A Collections Connection input to set options to include empty collections.

types.name: CommerceAmendment

A community is a social structure of Twitch users. Streamers may use them to
reach viewers interested in a specific type of content, and viewers can use them
to discover that content.

types.name: CommunityImageFormat

types.name: CommunityImageType

types.name: CommunityType

CreateClipInput creates a clip either from a broadcast or video. If both broadcastID

types.name: CreatePanelInput
types.description:
CreatePanelInput contains a panel with created data
The schema here has arguments for both extension panels and default panels
each panel needs a PanelType, and channelID it corresponds to,
but each panel does not need the other arguments
extension panels can have a slotID
default panels can have a title, image, link, and/or description.

types.name: CreatePanelPayload
types.description: CreatePanelPayload contains the panel data after the create succeeds.

types.description: Inputs to the createSegmentEvent mutation.

types.name: CreateSegmentEventPayload

types.name: CreateTimetableEventInput
types.description: Inputs to the createTimetableEvent mutation.

types.name: CreateTimetableEventPayload
types.description: Outputs from the createTimetableEvent mutation.

types.name: Cursor
types.description:
An opaque identifier for a connection edge. Used for pagination.

This is part of the Relay Cursor Connections Specification:
https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: DeactivateExtensionInput
types.description: The required input for a deactivateExtension mutation.

types.name: DeactivateExtensionPayload

types.name: DefaultPanel
types.description: DefaultPanel is the normal panel type that displays text and images.

types.name: DeleteChannelBlockedTermError
types.description: Errors that the mutation returns.

types.name: DeleteChannelBlockedTermInput

types.description: The errors returned from this mutation.

DeleteClipsInput accepts either a list of slugs, a video id, or a broadcast id

DeleteClipsPayload returns the deleted clips. Only the slug and id can be accessed

types.name: DeleteEventCollectionPayload

types.name: DeleteEventLeafPayload
types.description: Payload returned by the delete_event_leaf mutation.

types.name: DeleteEventPayload
types.description: Payload returned by the delete_event mutation.

types.name: DeprecatedEvent
types.description:
Deprecated

An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

The Event interface is the common set of fields that all events support.  There are several concrete Event types
that represent different kinds of scheduled content.  The kinds of content include one-off events, premieres,
tournaments, conferences and panels, shows and episodes etc.
The concrete Event types include additional fields that are needed to describe their kind of content.

NOTE: Clients should be resilient to new concrete types being added in the future.

NOTE: Events have been designed here using polymorphic types.
This is a (mostly) untested design pattern for API types, and we are currently learning about its advantages
and disadvantages.
Teams are encouraged to avoid polymorphic types and design their types to use composition instead, if possible.

types.name: DeprecatedEventConnection
types.description:
Paginated list of Events, where the relationship between the source type and the Event is
generic enough that no information needs to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: DeprecatedEventEdge
types.description:
Generic edge between some type and an Event, where there is no information that needs to
to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: Directory
types.description: A Directory is a container of content  Streams, Videos, and Clips  on Twitch.

types.name: DirectoryConnection
types.description:
Paginated list of Directories.
Implements the Relay cursor connections specification.
See: https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: DirectoryEdge
types.description:
Contains information about a Directory's relationship to a given page (connection),
and the Directory itself.

types.name: DirectoryFilter
types.description: The set of ways to filter directories.

types.name: DirectorySort
types.description: The set of ways to sort directories against each other.

types.name: DirectoryType
types.description: The set of types of directory.

types.name: DiscountType
types.description:
DEPRECATED: to be replaced by SubscriptionPromotionDiscountType.
Valid discount types for subscription products.

types.name: DismissRitualTokenInput
types.description: DismissRitualTokenInput is the input when dismissing a ritual token.

types.name: DismissRitualTokenPayload
types.description: DismissRitualTokenPayload is the response when dismissing a ritual token.

types.name: Drop
types.description: Contains all of the information about a Drop awarded to a user.

types.name: DropAward
types.description: Data about the award of a drop to a user.

types.name: DropCampaign
types.description:
A campaign a developer is running to give drops away to viewers of their game
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times
To apply to a particular channel a campaign must be live and additionally
the channel must be playing an applicable game and either must be one of the
applicable channels or the campaign must have an empty applicable channel list
(where an empty list specifically means all channels are eligible).

types.name: DropImageType
types.description: DropImageType is the list of possible uses that an image can have for drops.

types.name: Duration
types.description:
A possibly signed sequence of decimal numbers, each with optional fraction
and a unit suffix, such as "300ms", "-1.5h" or "2h45m".
Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "s"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

types.name: EditCommunityError
types.description:
EditCommunityError is a user error while editing a community
NOTE: Should have been named EditCommunityErrorCode.

types.name: EditCommunityInput
types.description:
EditCommunityInput contains the ID of the community to be updated
It also must contain at least one of description, display name, rules, or summary.

types.name: EditCommunityPayload
types.description: EditCommunityPayload is the response from editing a community.

types.name: EmbeddedEmote
types.description:
EmbeddedEmote is an encoding format used to describe an emote embedded in a string of text.

Example:
  body = "hey KappaHD"
  from = 4
  to = 10

  "KappaHD" will be replaced with the KappaHD emote image.

types.name: EmoteSet
types.description: Represents a group of emotes.

types.name: EmoteSetDomain
types.description: Domains that emotes belong to.

types.name: EmoteSetPurchaseToken
types.description:
EmoteSetPurchaseToken provides information related to a consumable purchase 
token about recently acquired emote sets.

types.name: Event
types.description:
An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

There are currently two high-level categories of events.  EventLeaf, which is a single event that may or may
not be part of a collection, or an EventCollection that groups leaves together.

types.name: EventBroadcast
types.description:
DEPRECATED: to be replaced by the Event interface.
EventBroadcast is a projected or past planned stream with a fixed start/end time, game and channel.

types.name: EventBroadcastSelfConnection
types.description:
DEPRECATED: EventBroadcast is being replaced by the Event interface
The relationship between the authenticated user and an event broadcast.

types.name: EventCollection
types.description: An event collection represents a group of event leaves.

types.name: EventCollectionConnection
types.description: Paginated list of event collections.

types.name: EventCollectionEdge
types.description: Generic edge between some type and an EventCollection.

types.name: EventConnectionCriteriaInput
types.description: Generic options for filtering pages of events.

types.name: EventConnectionFirstPageInput
types.description:
Defines where the first page of a listing of events starts.
Each field allows specifying a strategy to pick the first event on the first page.  Clients should
only set one of these fields to choose a strategy, and leave the others null.

types.name: EventLeaf
types.description: An event leaf represents a single event that may or may not be part of a collection.

types.name: EventLeafConnection
types.description: Paginated list of event leafs.

types.name: EventLeafEdge
types.description: Generic edge between some type and an EventLeaf.

types.name: EventNotificationSetting
types.description: Settings for a given event.

types.name: EventSelfConnection
types.description: EventSelfConnection contains information on the current authenticated user's interactions with an event.

types.name: EventSortBy
types.description: Sort field for events.

types.name: EventType
types.description:
Enumerates the different types of events.  Generally, clients should use branch on Leaf or Collection
and implement different behavior based on the presence of various fields on the objects.  The type field
should only be used for labeling, and in the admin edit interface.

types.name: EventTypeBroadcastType
types.description: Describes describes the source of a Video that covers an Event.

types.name: EventVideoConnection
types.description: A paginated list of Videos that cover an Event.

types.name: EventVideoEdge
types.description: Contains information on the Event's relationship with the Video, and the Video itself.

types.name: Extension
types.description: Twitch Extension.

types.name: ExtensionActivationConfig
types.description: The current activation configuration for an installed extension.

types.name: ExtensionActivationInput
types.description:
Represents the action which should be taken on the provided installation ID. If no
anchor configuration is provided, the installation will be deactivated.

types.name: ExtensionAnchor
types.description: The possible values for an Extension Anchor.

types.name: ExtensionConnection
types.description: A paginated list of extensions, and its metadata.

types.name: ExtensionEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated extensions of videos, and its metadata.

types.name: ExtensionInstallation
types.description: Extension Installation are models which contain an Extension and it's associated installation metadata.

types.name: ExtensionInstallationSelfConnection
types.description: The connection a user has to an Installed Extension.

types.name: ExtensionPanel
types.description: ExtensionPanel is a placeholder in the panel list for arbitrary iframed content.

types.name: ExtensionRequiredAction
types.description: The action a user must take to complete an activation of an extension installation.

types.name: ExtensionRequiredActionType
types.description: The possible types of required actions after attempting to activate an extension.

types.name: ExtensionSelfConnection
types.description: The connection a user has to an Extension object.

types.name: ExtensionState
types.description: The possible values for ExtensionState.

types.name: ExtensionStateFilter
types.description: ExtensionStateFilter contains all the valid states to filter the list of extensions by.

types.name: ExtensionToken
types.description: The user-specific token for an installed extension on a channel.

types.name: ExtensionView
types.description: ExtensionView is the interface which every anchor-specific extension view extends from.

types.name: ExtensionViews
types.description: The potential anchor-specific configurations and extension can have.

types.name: FeaturedContentSection
types.description: FeaturedContentSections contain the a set of FeaturedItems that should be shown together in a particular section of Twitch apps.

types.name: FeaturedEventBroadcasts
types.description:
DEPRECATED: to be replaced by FeaturedEventsByTime.
A collection of events that have been featured for this game.

types.name: FeaturedStream
types.description: FeaturedStream contains extra metadata for presenting a featured Stream.

types.name: FeaturedVideo
types.description:
DEPRECATED: do not use, it is subject to change.
FeaturedVideo contains extra metadata for presenting a featured video.

types.name: Feed
types.description: Feed is twitch's pulse product of content a user may enjoy.

types.name: FeedItem
types.description:
FeedItem is the units of a feed.
They do not have an identifier because you cannot look them up by identifier.

types.name: FeedItemContent
types.description: FeedItemContent is the supported content types that may appear in a feed.

types.name: FeedItemReason
types.description: FeedItemReason explains why an item is in your feed.

types.name: FeedItemTracking
types.description: FeedItemTracking contains the tracking info of a feeditem.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Follow
types.description: Data about the relationship between one User and a User they are following.

types.name: FollowConnection
types.description: A paginated list of follows relationships.

types.name: FollowDeprecatedEventPayload
types.description: The result of a followDeprecatedEvent mutation.

types.name: FollowEdge
types.description:
An element in a paginated list of follows relationships.
Contains metadata about the follow relationship between two users.

types.name: FollowEventInput
types.description: The required input for a followEvent mutation.

types.name: FollowEventPayload
types.description: The result of a followEvent mutation.

types.name: FollowGameInput
types.description: FollowGameInput contains just the game ID of the game to follow.

types.name: FollowGamePayload
types.description: FollowGamePayload is the response from following a game.

types.name: FollowedCommunityConnection
types.description: Paginated list of followed communities.

types.name: FollowedGameConnection
types.description: A list of followed games.

types.name: FollowedHostConnection
types.description: A list of broadcasters followed by a user and hosting live broadcasters.

types.name: FollowedLiveUserConnection
types.description: A list of live-streaming broadcasters followed by a user.

types.name: FollowedLiveUserEdge
types.description: A live streaming broadcaster with cursor.

types.name: FollowerConnection
types.description: A paginated list of followers relationships.

types.name: FollowerEdge
types.description:
An element in a paginated list of followers.
Contains metadata about the follower relationship between two users.

types.name: FragmentContent
types.description:
FragmentContent contains the parse content of a fragment, and can be an emote or a mention.
NOTE: should have been called RoomMessageFragmentContent.

types.name: FriendConnection
types.description: A list of a user's friend relationships.

types.name: FriendEdge
types.description: The friendship between the authenticated user and another user.

types.name: FriendSort
types.description: Decides how to sort Friendship-related responses.

types.name: FulfillmentDetail
types.description:
Information about how to acquire or launch a game.
For Commenrce.

types.name: Game
types.description: A Game is often the subject of a Stream on Twitch.

types.name: GameClipsInput
types.description: Filtering criteria for paginated game clips results.

types.name: GameConnection
types.description:
Paginated list of Games.
Implements the Relay cursor connections specification.
See: https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: GameEdge
types.description:
Contains information about a Game's relationship to a given page (connection),
and the Game itself.

types.name: GameFollow
types.description: Game followed by a User.

types.name: GameProduct
types.description:
Details about how to acquire and launch this game as well as available in-game content purchases.
For Commerce.

types.name: GameSelfConnection
types.description: The relationship between the authenticated user and a game.

types.name: Hearthstone
types.description: Contains Heartstone game specific information.

types.name: HiddenView
types.description: HiddenView holds the view configuration of an extension if it is a hidden load test extension.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: InGameContent
types.description:
Information about a purchasable in-game item.
For Commerce.

types.name: InGameContentPurchaseToken
types.description:
InGameContentPurchaseToken provides information related to a consumable purchase 
token about recently acquired in game content.

types.name: IncomingFriendRequestConnection
types.description: Friend requests sent from other users to this user.

types.name: IncomingFriendRequestEdge
types.description: A friend request sent from another user to this user.

types.name: InstallExtensionInput
types.description: The required input for an installExtension mutation.

types.name: InstallExtensionPayload
types.description: The result of an installExtension mutation.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Inventory
types.description:
Contains the inventory for a particular user. Inventory consists of
Drops awarded, Crates, emotes from Crates, badges from Crates, and
Bits.

types.name: Language
types.description: An enumeration of languages available on Twitch.

types.name: LanguageTag
types.description: An enumeration of user language tags (shortened BCP 47) available on Twitch. This should not be confused with Language, which is broadcaster language.

types.name: LeaderboardTimePeriodType
types.description: LeaderboardTimePeriodType enumerates the various types of supported Leaderboards.

types.name: LeagueOfLegends
types.description: Contains Leagueoflegends game specific information.

types.name: LinkOEmbed
types.description: LinkOEmbed is a link oEmbed.  This looks strange being empty, but mirrors the oEmbed official spec most exactly.

types.name: LiveConfigView
types.description: LiveConfigView holds the view configuration of an extension if the live config dashboard page is supported.

types.name: ManagedEventLeavesCriteriaInput
types.description: Options for fetching pages of managed event leaves.

types.name: MaturityRating
types.description:
Governmental rating agency information.
For Commerce.

types.name: Media
types.description: Media associated with a product.

types.name: MerchandiseProduct
types.description:
A product is an item that we sell on twitch
For Commerce.

types.name: MessageBody
types.description:
MessageBody is a way of encoding emote annotated text.  The original text is included as content and the
parsed emotes are included which indicate the start and end indexes they should replace.

types.name: Milestone
types.description:
Milestone is a construct is used within a tournament. For a given threshold, when the user 
cheers at or past this amount, they are able to claim a reward for cheering at this level.
Rewards can be fulfilled by different platforms.
Types of milestones:
- **Global milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when cheers from all 
  users on the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for all users who have cheered.
- **Individual milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual 
  user's total cheers in the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.
- **Team milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual cheers 
  for a specific team in total is greater than or equal to the threshold. 
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.

NOTE: Should have been named CheeringTournamentMilestone.

types.name: MobileView
types.description: MobileView holds the view configuration of an extension if mobile is supported.

types.name: ModConnection
types.description: Paginated list of moderators of a channel.

types.name: ModEdge
types.description: Element in a list of moderators of a channel.

types.name: ModUserError
types.description: ModUserError contains details about a client error that occurred.

types.name: ModUserErrorCode
types.description: ModUserErrorCode defines a client error that occurred while adding a moderator.

types.name: ModUserInput
types.description: ModUserInput contains the parameters to add a user as a moderator to a channel.

types.name: ModUserPayload
types.description: ModUserPayload is the response when adding a user as a moderator.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Operations to update data in the Twitch API.

types.name: OEmbed
types.description: OEmbed is a universal spec converted to GraphQL from http://oembed.com/.

types.name: OfferDeliveryMethod
types.description:
Deliver method type for Prime Offers entitlements.
Note: This should have been named PrimeOfferDeliveryMethod.

types.name: Onboarding
types.description: Current state of the user in the onboarding process.

types.name: Overwatch
types.description: Contains Overwatch game specific information.

types.name: PUBG
types.description: Contains PUBG game specific information.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo is a special field which contains information about the page,
specifically the cursors which the page starts and ends, and whether or
not the client can forward-paginate or backward-paginate.

This is part of the Relay Cursor Connections Specification:
https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: PaidUpgrade

Data about a paid upgrade for a subscription.
ie. a user upgrades a 1-month gift to a recurring subscription.

types.name: Panel
types.description: Panel is information about a single info panel for a channel.

types.name: PanelActivationInput
types.description: The required configuration to activate a panel extension.

types.name: PanelType
types.description: PanelType is the kind of panel.

types.name: PanelView
types.description: PanelView holds the view configuration of an extension if the panel anchor is supported.

types.name: Partnership
types.description: DEPRECATED.

types.name: PayPalBillingAgreement
types.description: PayPalBillingAgreement describes a user's PayPal billing agreement for recurring or one time PayPal payments for goods or services.

types.name: PaymentCardType
types.description: Types of credit cards supported.

types.name: PaymentInstrumentType
types.description: Payment instrument used through the payment provider.

types.name: PaymentMethod
types.description: Type of payment method a user has used to buy products on Twitch, such as subs.

types.name: PaymentProvider
types.description: Type of payment providers.

types.name: PaymentTransaction
types.description:
There are legacy and new data sources that contain similar payment transaction data. This type aims to merge several
data sources into one to expose a consistent payment history for each Twitch user.

types.description: A paginated list of payment transactions, and its metadata.

types.name: PaymentTransactionConnectionCriteriaInput
types.description: Filter and sorting options for querying all transactions for a Twitch purchaser.

types.name: PaymentTransactionEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated list of payment transactions, and its metadata.

types.name: PaymentTransactionProduct
types.description: Payment transaction purchased product details.

types.name: PaymentTransactionSort
types.description: Possible sort orders for lists of payment transactions.

types.name: PaymentTransactionType
types.description: Payment transaction type, currently only subscription payments are surfaced. More types to be added soon such as Bits.

types.name: PaymentTransactionTypeFilter
types.description: Select the kind of transactions.

types.description: Enumerates valid payout categories.

types.name: PayoutInvite
types.description: PayoutInvite describes a user's invite to a payout program.

types.name: PayoutOnboardingCategory
types.description: PayoutOnboardingCategory enumerates valid categories for payout onboarding.

types.name: PayoutOnboardingStep

types.name: PayoutOnboardingWorkflow
types.description: PayoutOnboardingWorkflow describes the workflow details while a user is onboarding into a payout program.

types.name: PayoutPlan

types.name: PayoutPlanTag
types.description: Enumerates valid payout plan tags.

types.name: PayoutRegistration
types.description: PayoutRegistration describes the personal information a user submitted while onboarding into a payout program.

types.name: PinnedCheerType
types.description:
PinnedCheerType is the type of pinned cheer to remove.
Used as input in the DismissPinnedCheer mutation.

types.name: PostEmbed
types.description: TODO: Add events.

types.name: PremiereEvent
types.description: PremiereEvent represents a one-off, stand-alone event where the content is a Premiere.

types.name: PremiereItem
types.description: The types of objects that can be contained in a premiere.

types.name: PremiereItemEdge
types.description:
A page entry, that contains a premiere item and a cursor to return
from the query to allow pagination.
NOTE: this should have been named PremiereEdge.

types.name: PrimeEmoticons
types.description: Wrapper around standard Emoticons for Prime Smilies Emoticons.

types.description: The Names for the smilies Emoticon sets supported by Prime.

types.name: PrimeOffer
types.description: Prime Digital Content Offers are displayed to users on Twitch via Offers in the top nav.

types.name: PrimeOfferContent
types.description: An Object containing metadata for Digital Content.

types.name: PrimeOfferSelfConnection
types.description: The connection between the user and their offer entitlement state.

types.name: PrimePromotion
types.description: Metadata relevant to Prime copy or marketing that needs to be scheduled.

types.name: PrimeSettings
types.description: Prime Settings related data for a given user.

types.name: ProductInfo
types.description:
General purchase information for a commerce item (games or in-game content).
For Commerce.

types.name: ProductLanguage
types.description:
Language provides information about how the language is supported for a product.
For Commerce.

types.name: ProductMedia
types.description:
Aggregates all media associated with this product. E.g. screnshots, box art, videos.
For Commerce.

types.name: ProgramAgreement
types.description: ProgramAgreement describes the End User License Agreement associated with a user's current payout plan.

types.name: PublishClipError
types.description: PublishClipError is an error associated with the publishClip mutation.

types.name: PublishClipPayload

types.name: PurchaseProfile
types.description: Purchase profile of a recurring or non-recurring subscription that a user bought.

types.name: PurchaseToken
types.description:
PurchaseToken is a token that appears in the chat, specific to 
a tuid/channel (i.e. if a customer buys a product, we give them the option of 
sharing it in the channel they bought it from).

types.name: Query
types.description: Root fields to access the Twitch API.

types.name: RedeemRitualTokenInput

types.name: RedeemRitualTokenPayload
types.description: RedeemRitualTokenPayload is the response when redeeming a ritual token.

types.name: RegisterPayoutInformationError
types.description: RegisterPayoutInformationError describes the error that occured when registering a user's payout information during payout onboarding.

types.name: RegisterPayoutInformationErrorCode
types.description: Enumerates possible errors when registering payout information.

types.name: RegisterPayoutInformationFieldName
types.description: Enumerates vaid field names when registering payout information.

types.description: RegisterPayoutInformationInput is the input required to register a user's payout information during payout onboarding.

types.name: RegisterPayoutInformationPayload
types.description: RegisterPayoutInformationPayload is the updated workflow after registration is accepted.

types.name: RemoveCollectionItemInput
types.description: RemoveCollectionItemInput accepts a collectionID and item ID and parameters to remove the item from a collection.

types.description: The response from removing an item from a collection.

types.name: ReorderCollectionItemPayload

types.name: ReportContentType
types.description: Types of content that can be reported.

types.name: ReportReason
types.description: A valid reason for a report.

types.name: RequestInfo
types.description: Metadata about a GraphQL request.

types.description: RequestRitualTokenInput is the input when requesting a ritual token.

types.name: RequestRitualTokenPayload

types.name: RetailProduct
types.description:
Details associated with a retail product offer.
For Commerce.

types.name: RitualToken
types.description:
A ritual is an opportunity for a viewer to better connect with a streamer's
community by announcing when they reach milestones in the channel.
A ritual token is issued when a user is eligible for the ritual, and can be
redeemed to send the announcement in a channel.

types.name: Room
types.description: A chatroom associated with a channel where members of the room can exchange messages.

types.name: RoomMemberConnection
types.description: Paginated list of room members (users).

types.name: RoomMemberEdge
types.description: Element in a list of room members.

types.name: RoomMemberType
types.description: Type of user for grouping users in the rooms member list.

types.name: RoomMessage
types.description: A message sent from a user to a room.

types.name: RoomMessageConnection
types.description: Paginated list of messages in a room.

types.name: RoomMessageContent
types.description: The content of a user's message to a room.

types.name: RoomMessageEdge
types.description: Element in a list of messages.

types.name: RoomMessageFragment
types.description: One parsed part of a message, which may be an emote, mention, or plaintext.

types.name: RoomModes
types.description: Modes that have been enabled for the room.

types.name: RoomPermissions
types.description: Represents the permissions a user has in a room.

types.name: RoomRole
types.description:
Describes the role a user must be in order to perform an action, such as sending messages. Roles are
hierarchical, so users that meet a role also meet all lower roles as well. For example, a moderator
meets the subscriber role, even if they are not subscribed to the channel. Roles are defined in order
from highest to lowest in the enum.

types.name: RoomRolePermissions
types.description: RoomRolePermissions describes the role necessary to perform actions in a room.

types.name: RoomView
types.description:
A RoomView represents the authenticated user's self connection to a room, and includes the user's
settings and permissions.

types.name: SCETitle
types.description:
Sony Computer Entertainment (SCE) title properties.
Used as part of stream metadata for PlayStation.

types.name: SCEUser
types.description:
Sony Computer Entertainment (SCE) user properties.
Used as part of stream metadata for PlayStation.

types.name: SSOLink
types.description:
A link between a single sign-on (SSO) app and a Twitch account.
SSO apps are the Twitch apps on console and smart TV.

types.name: SegmentEvent
types.description:
Segment events are sub-events that represent a piece of content that is part of a greater event.
SegmentEvent would be good at representing:
  * A single run of a gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the runs for "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" together.
  * A single panel in a conference like "TwitchCon 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the panels for the conference together.

types.name: SegmentParentEvent
types.description:
SegmentParentEvent defines the types of container-events that a SegmentEvent may be a part of.
NOTE: Clients should be resilient to SegmentParentEvent including new types in the future.

types.name: SetPreferredLanguageTagInput
types.description: The required input for a setPreferredLanguageTag mutation.

types.name: SetPreferredLanguageTagPayload
types.description: The result of a setPreferredLanguageTag mutation.

types.name: SetSessionStatusInput
types.description:
SetSessionStatusInput represents a user's status within a single session (browser tab, game, desktop application,
mobile application, etc.).

types.name: SetUserResidenceInput
types.description: SetUserResidenceInput is input required to set a user's residence.

types.name: SetUserResidencePayload
types.description: SetUserResidencePayload is the response from the SetUserResidence mutation.

types.name: SharePurchaseTokenInChatPayload
types.description: SharePurchaseTokenInChatPayload contains the token value of the shared purchase token.

types.name: SingleEvent
types.description: SingleEvent represents a one-off, stand-alone event where the content is a live stream on a single channel.

types.name: SmiliesSet
types.description: Wrapper around the standard emoticon groups for Prime Emoticons.

types.name: SortOrder
types.description: Sort direction.

types.name: SpendSubscriptionCreditError
types.description: Error returned when attempting to spend subscription credit.

types.name: SpendSubscriptionCreditErrorCode

types.name: SpendSubscriptionCreditInput

types.name: SpendSubscriptionCreditPayload
types.description: Mutated data after spending the subscription credit.

types.name: StartPayoutOnboardingWorkflowInput
types.description: StartPayoutOnboardingWorkflowInput returns the required input when starting a new workflow for payout onboarding.

types.name: StartPayoutOnboardingWorkflowPayload
types.description: StartPayoutOnboardingWorkflowPayload returns a new workflow when starting payout onboarding.

types.name: Stream
types.description: A live stream.

types.name: StreamConnection
types.description: Paginated list of Streams.

types.name: StreamEdge
types.description:
Contains information about a Streams's relationship to a given page (connection),

types.name: StreamMetadataFilterInput
types.description:
Query to let consumers filter streams that have specific metadata.
e.g. return only those hearthstone streams that have broadcasterheroclass as mage.
FE uses these parameters to implemtent filters.

types.name: StreamSelfConnection
types.description: The relationship between the authenticated user and a stream.

types.name: StreamSort
types.description: Possible ways of sorting collections of live streams.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: SubscribedChannelConnection
types.description: A list of channels subscribed to by a user.

types.name: SubscribedChannelEdge
types.description: A broadcaster user with cursor.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefit
types.description: Data about a user's subscription to a broadcaster.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefitConnection
types.description: A paginated list of subscription benefits.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefitCriteriaInput
types.description: Criteria for building paginated list of user's all active subscriptions.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefitEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated list of subscription benefits.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefitFilter

types.name: SubscriptionCheckoutConfigs
types.description: Configs that help initiate the subscription checkout flow.

types.name: SubscriptionGift
types.description: Gift information for a subscription benefit.

types.name: SubscriptionInterval
types.description: Represents the interval of a subscription product.

types.name: SubscriptionIntervalUnit
types.description: Denotes the unit of the period of a subscription product.

types.name: SubscriptionPlatform
types.description: SubscriptionPlatform enumerates platform options such as WEB, IOS, ANDROID.

types.name: SubscriptionProduct
types.description:
A subscription that is purchasable by users.
Once purchased, the subscription entitles the user to use special emote sets on Twitch.

types.name: SubscriptionProductSelfConnection
types.description: The connection between the user and subscription product.

types.name: SubscriptionProductType
types.description: The types of subscription products that can be purchased.

types.name: SubscriptionPromotion
types.description: The promotion offer on subscription product.

types.name: SubscriptionPromotionDiscountType
types.description: Valid discount types for Subscription promotion.

types.name: SubscriptionPurchase
types.description: A user's subscription purchase details, part of the Subscription Checkout workflow.

types.name: SubscriptionPurchaseDetails
types.description: The receipt details for a subscription purchase.

types.name: SubscriptionPurchaseState
types.description: The various states of the subscription purchase receipt.

types.name: SupportedPlatform
types.description:
Platform information for a game.
NOTE: Should have been named GameSupportedPlatform.
For Commerce.

types.name: SystemRequirement
types.description:
SystemRequirement aggregates information about the hardware and software needed to run the product.
For Commerce.

types.name: TaxInterview
types.description: TaxInterview describes the information for a user's Amazon tax interview during payout onboarding.

types.name: TaxInterviewType
types.description: TaxInterviewType enumerates valid Amazon tax interview types.

types.name: TaxMismatchError
types.description: TaxMismatchError enumerates valid registration and tax interview field names for payout onboarding.

types.name: Team
types.description: Stream team details.

types.name: Time
types.description:
RFC3339 timestamp.
For example "2015-07-22T21:41:14Z".

types.name: TimeoutUserFromCommunityError
types.description:
TimeoutUserFromCommunityError is the error code while timing out a user from a community.
NOTE: Should have been named TimeoutUserFromCommunityErrorCode.

types.name: TimetableChildEvent
types.description:
TimetableChildEvent defines the types of sub-events that a TimetableEvent may contain.
NOTE: Clients should be resilient to TimetableChildEvent including new types in the future.

types.name: TimetableChildEventConnection
types.description: Paginated list of sub-events that are part of a TimetableEvent.

types.name: TimetableEvent
types.description:
TimetableEvent describes an event that comprises of a collection of closely related sub-events.
TimetableEvent would be good at representing:
  * A gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" which each run is its own piece of content that can
    be represented by a SegmentEvent
  * A conference like "TwitchCon 2017" where each panel is its own piece of content that can be represented
    by a SegmentEvent.

types.name: Tournament
types.description:
Tournament is an object that contains all information about a tournament
managed within Bits for a specific event tied to cheering.
NOTE: Should have been named CheeringTournament.

types.name: TournamentInsiderRewards
types.description: Contains all rewards information about the Insider rewards.

types.name: TournamentProgress
types.description: Describes the amount of progress that has been made in a tournament, with corresponding milestones about said progress.

types.name: TournamentReward
types.description: Type containing information about a Reward and claiming information.

types.name: TournamentRewards
types.description:
This type holds all information about rewards that are associated with a tournament. The struct parses out
which rewards are Global, Team, and Individual, as well as if you're logged in that status if you can claim the reward.

types.name: TournamentSelfEdge
types.description: Tournament progress related to a user.

types.name: TournamentTeam
types.description:
Team is a construct that contains metadata about a team participating in the tournament,
as well as the milestones associated with cheering for them.

types.name: TrueXAd
types.description:
TrueXAd is descriptive information about an engagement that was show for bits.
Used as input on the redeem trueXAd mutation.

types.name: UnfollowDeprecatedEventPayload
types.description: The result of an unfollowDeprecatedEvent mutation.

types.name: UnfollowEventInput
types.description: The required input for an unfollowEvent mutation.

types.name: UnfollowEventPayload
types.description: The result of an unfollowEvent mutation.

types.name: UnfollowGameInput
types.description: UnfollowGameInput contains just the game ID of the game to unfollow.

types.name: UnfollowGamePayload
types.description: UnfollowGamePayload is the response from unfollowing a game.

types.name: UninstallExtensionInput
types.description: The required input for an uninstallExtension mutation.

types.name: UninstallExtensionPayload
types.description: The resulting payload of an uninstallExtension mutation.

types.name: UnmodUserError
types.description: ModUserError contains details about a client error that occurred.

types.name: UnmodUserErrorCode
types.description: UnmodUserErrorCode defines a client error that occurred while remove a moderator.

types.name: UnmodUserInput
types.description: UnmodUserInput contains the parameters to remove a user as a moderator to a channel.

types.name: UnmodUserPayload
types.description: UnmodUserPayload is the response when remove a user as a moderator.

types.name: UnsubscribeEmailInput
types.description: Input to the unsubscribe mutation. One of "channel" or "type" fields must be provided.

types.name: UnsubscribeEmailPayload
types.description: Output from the unsubscribe mutation.

types.name: UpdateBroadcastSettingsInput
types.description: The required input for a updateBroadcastSettings mutation.

types.name: UpdateBroadcastSettingsPayload
types.description: The result of a updateBroadcastSettings mutation.

types.name: UpdateChatSettingsInput
types.description: Possible chat settings modifiable for the channel specified via ChannelID.

types.name: UpdateChatSettingsPayload
types.description: Result of mutation is the updated ChatSettings object.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsChatMessageInput
types.description: Partner settings related to chat messages with bits.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsCustomPrefixInput
types.description: Partner settings related to the custom cheermote prefix.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsInput
types.description: Mutation input for updating Bits partner channel settings.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsLeaderboardInput
types.description: Partner settings related to the bits leaderboard.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsPayload
types.description: Result of mutation is the updated UserSettings object.

types.name: UpdateCheerPartnerSettingsRecentCheerInput
types.description: Partner settings related to the recent cheer message.

types.name: UpdateClipError
types.description: UpdateClipError is an error associated with the updateClip mutation.

types.name: UpdateClipInput
types.description: UpdateClipInput updates the title of the clip with the provided slug.

types.name: UpdateClipPayload
types.description: UpdateClipPayload returns the updated clip.

types.name: UpdateClipViewCountInput
types.description: UpdateClipViewCountInput increments the viewcount of the provided slug.

types.name: UpdateClipViewCountPayload
types.description: UpdateClipViewCount returns the clip that was updated.

types.name: UpdateCollectionInput
types.description: UpdateCollectionInput accepts a collection ID and parameters to update a collection.

types.name: UpdateCollectionPayload
types.description: UpdateCollectionPayload resolves the updated collection.

types.name: UpdateCollectionThumbnailInput
types.description: UpdateCollectionThumbnailInput accepts a item ID and item Type for the new collection's thumbnail.

types.name: UpdateEventBroadcastNotificationsInput
types.description: Input for mutation to modify a user's settings about notifications for an event broadcast.

types.name: UpdateEventBroadcastNotificationsPayload
types.description: Response payload for the mutation to follow an event broadcast.

types.name: UpdateIsSharingActivityInput
types.description:
Updates the user's activity sharing setting. This must only be sent in response to a direct action by the user
intended to change the setting.

types.name: UpdateOnboardingSkippedChannelsInput
types.description: Used for mutating onboarding status.

types.name: UpdateOnboardingSkippedChannelsPayload
types.description: Returned after onboarding state is mutated.

types.name: UpdatePremiereEventInput
types.description: Inputs to the updatePremiereEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdatePremiereEventPayload
types.description: Output from the updatePremiereEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdatePrimeSettingsInput
types.description:
UpdatePrimeSettingsInput contains boolean for setting the users preference on chat notifications,
and the users preference on the emoticon set name to be selected.

types.name: UpdatePrimeSettingsPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated.

types.name: UpdateSegmentEventInput
types.description: Inputs to the updateSegmentEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateSegmentEventPayload
types.description: Output from the updateSegmentEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateSingleEventInput
types.description: Inputs to the updateSingleEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateSingleEventPayload
types.description: Output from the updateSingleEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateSubscriptionProductInput
types.description: Inputs to the updateSubscriptionProduct mutation.

types.name: UpdateSubscriptionProductPayload
types.description: Output from the updateSubscriptionProduct mutation.

types.name: UpdateTimetableEventInput
types.description: Inputs to the updateTimetableEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateTimetableEventPayload
types.description: Output from the updateTimetableEvent mutation.

types.name: UpdateUserDirectoryHiddenInput
types.description: The required input for a updateUserDirectoryHidden mutation.

types.name: UpdateUserDirectoryHiddenPayload
types.description: The result of a updateUserDirectoryHidden mutation.

types.name: UpdateUserSubscriptionSettingsInput
types.description: UpdateUserSubscriptionSettingsInput updates the users subscription settings.

types.name: UpdateUserSubscriptionSettingsPayload
types.description: UpdateUserSubscriptionGiftSettingsPayload returns the user's current gift settings.

types.name: UpdateVisibilityInput
types.description:
The change that will be applied to the user's visibility. See VisibilityInput for details on the effects of each
value.

types.name: User
types.description: Twitch user.

types.name: UserAmazonConnection
types.description: The relationship between the user and Amazon.

types.name: UserClipsInput
types.description: Filtering criteria for paginated user clips results.

types.name: UserConnection
types.description:
Paginated list of Users, where the relationship between the source type and the User is
generic enough that no information needs to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: UserDirectoryConnection
types.description: The connection between a user and the directories they have selected to broadcast in.

types.name: UserDropAwardConnection
types.description: A list of Drops awarded to the user.

types.name: UserEdge
types.description:
Generic edge between some type and a User, where there is no information that needs to
to be encoded on the edge.

types.name: UserResidence
types.description: User's residence.

types.name: UserRoles
types.description: Groups site-wide user roles together.

types.name: UserSelfBitsBadge
types.description:
UserSelfBitsBadge contains the current user's badge tier in a channel and progress toward the next tier.
NOTE: should probably have been named CurrentUserBitsBadge.

types.name: UserSelfConnection
types.description: Subjective data on another User (user/channel) for the current user.

types.name: UserSettings
types.description: Groups site-wide user settings together.

types.name: UserSubscriptionSettings
types.description:
User preferences related to subscriptions and subscription gifts.
ie. Can I receive gifts to all channels or only channels I follow?

types.name: UserTwitchConnection
types.description: The relationship between the user and Twitch.

types.name: VideoComment
types.description: Comment on a video.

types.name: VideoCommentConnection
types.description: Paginated list of comments.

types.name: VideoCommentEdge
types.description: Video comment edge with cursor and the comment node.

types.name: VideoCommentMessage
types.description: Represents the message of a comment.

types.name: VideoCommentMessageFragment
types.description: Represents a part of the message body with meta info.

types.name: VideoCommentState
types.description: Represents the state of a video comment.

types.name: VideoConnection
types.description: A paginated list of videos, and its metadata.

types.name: VideoConnectionSearchParams
types.description: A Video Connection Search input to set params to include search term.

types.name: VideoEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated list of videos, and its metadata.

types.name: VideoOptions
types.description: Options to include private videos.

types.name: VideoOverlayActivationInput
types.description: The required configuration to activate a video overlay extension.

types.name: VideoOverlayView
types.description: VideoOverlayView holds the view configuration of an extension if the videoOverlay anchor is supported.

types.name: VideoSelfEdge
types.description: The relationship between the authenticated user and a video.

types.name: VideoSort
types.description: Possible sort orders for lists of videos.

types.name: VideoViewingHistory
types.description: User's viewing history against a video. All fields are null if no viewing history is available.

types.name: ViewedVideosConnection
types.description: A paginated list of viewed videos, their histories, and metadata.

types.name: ViewedVideosEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated list of viewing histories, and its metadata.

types.name: Visibility
types.description:
The user's shared availability while online.
A value of ONLINE (typically called invisibility) additionally means that the user's activity will not be shared
regardless of the isSharingActivity setting.
NOTE: Should have been named UserOnlineVisibility.

types.name: VisibilityInput
types.description: A visibility type for the user.

types.name: WhisperMessage
types.description: A message sent in a whisper thread.

types.name: WhisperMessageConnection
types.description: Paginated list of messages in a thread.

types.name: WhisperMessageEdge
types.description: Element in a list of messages.

types.name: WhisperSpamInfo
types.description: Spam classification data for a message.

types.name: WhisperThread
types.description: A conversation between two users.

types.name: WhisperThreadConnection
types.description: Paginated list of whisper threads.

types.name: WhisperThreadEdge
types.description: Element in a list of whisper threads.

types.name: Xbox
types.description: Stream metadata for Xbox.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior
in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or
skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information
to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in
a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has
a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all
available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for
query, mutation, and subscription operations.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of
types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that
type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while
Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields
they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types
possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.
